projectPurpose: To provide security professionals with a fast, efficient, and Sigma-rule-driven tool for analyzing Windows event logs to identify malicious activity and reconstruct timelines of events.
mainFeatures: Fast forensics timeline generation for Windows event logs
Supports full Sigma specification including v2 correlation rules
Extracts only useful data for concise output
Written in Rust for speed and memory safety

alternatives.name: Chainsaw
mainFeatures: Sigma rule detection against Windows event logs
Search event logs by event ID, keyword, and regex patterns
Rapid triage of Windows event logs

alternatives.name: ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana)
mainFeatures: Ingest, index, analyze, and visualize logs (including Windows events via Winlogbeat)

alternatives.name: Log2timeline / Plaso
mainFeatures: Generates chronological timelines from various forensic artifacts
Parses numerous file formats and data sources
Extracts and formats Windows Event Log message strings

alternatives.name: Splunk
mainFeatures: Ingestion, indexing, search, analysis, and visualization of machine data

alternatives.name: Graylog
mainFeatures: Centralized log collection, storage, and analysis

alternatives.name: APT-Hunter
mainFeatures: Threat hunting tool for Windows event logs
Detects suspicious activity and tracks APT movements
Maps findings to MITRE ATT&CK framework
Reduces large volumes of events to highlight significant threats
Detects various attacks (suspicious accounts, brute force, etc.)

alternatives.name: DeepBlue CLI
mainFeatures: PowerShell-based tool for analyzing Windows event logs
Focuses on lateral movement and credential abuse

marketPositioning: Hayabusa is positioned as a specialized, high-performance, open-source command-line tool for fast forensics and threat hunting specifically focused on Windows event logs. Its key advantages are its speed (built with Rust and multi-threading) and its comprehensive, native support for the Sigma rule format, including v2 correlation rules, which it highlights as a unique feature among open-source alternatives. Unlike broader SIEM or log analysis platforms that require more infrastructure, Hayabusa provides a dedicated and efficient way for security analysts and forensicators to quickly process and analyze Windows event logs and generate actionable timelines based on standardized detection rules.
